CatDescriptText: Miss Joyce Elliott, student of art, of 1214 Ozan Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that American citizens should receive Russia's first deputy premier, Anastas I. Mikoyan hospitably, or deport themselves in unhospitable fashion like some have done in several cities where Mikoyan has visited?" answer reads: �I think that we should receive him as our guest. The better impression we create on him over here perhaps the better impression that we will make over there.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joyce Elliott, wearing patterned blouse and light colored coat, standing with left hand in pocket on Smithfield Street across from C.C. Mellor Co. and Sherwin Williams, Downtown
